attributes.action: EVALUATE THE COMPULSORY RE-INTRODUCTION OF FINAL SALARY PENSION SCHEMES UNDERWRITTEN BY THE GOVERNMENT AND PAID FOR BY HIGHER CORPORATION TAX AND INCOME TAX
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Pensions are a ticking timebomb. Establish a full analysis of the costs of compulsory final salary pensions for all companies, and public sector areas, employing 500 or more. If the company cannot fund this, it should be underwritten by the Government with a higher Corporation tax rate, and a slightly higher income tax rate for those in it. Suggest max pension of £50k pa regardless of salary. Those in the scheme will not get an old age pension - i.e. contracted out. The estimated pension fund deficits are less than the banking bail out, confidence would return long term. A full scale costing of this should be instigated.

rejection.details: Please address the excessive use of capital letters; they make your petition hard to read.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
